intro: Diplazium atirrense, commonly known as the Brazilian sword fern, is a species of fern native to South America. It belongs to the family Thelypteridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The botanical features of Diplazium atirrense make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
